sen.j: 小川 可進（おがわ かしん、天明6年（1786年） - 安政2年5月2日 (旧暦)（1855年6月15日））は、煎茶道小川流の創始者、初代小川後楽。
sen.e: Kashin OGAWA (1786 - June 15, 1855) was the founder of Ogawa school of green tea ceremony and the first Koraku OGAWA.
sen.cmt: 「安政2年5月2日」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1855年6月15日 」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki

sen.j: 京都の医者の家系の出身で、自身も漢方医で、公家の御典医を務めていた。
sen.e: He came from a physician family line in Kyoto and was a Chinese medicine doctor himself serving Court nobles as a Gotenni (doctor who is hired by bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) or daimyo (feudal lord)).

sen.e: He became concerned about Sencha (green tea of middle grade) with his interest in nutrition of tea as a physician.

sen.j: 時代は化政文化の最盛期で庶民にまで異国趣味としての煎茶への関心が高まっていた。
sen.e: It was during the zenith of the Kasei culture, where interests in Sencha was increasing out of exoticism even among the common people.

sen.e: He seemed to feel doubt about the Sencha boom of those days, in which collection of products of Chinese culture was showed off.

sen.j: 独自の煎茶法を広めるべく50歳の時に医者を廃業。
sen.e: He gave up his practice as a physician at the age of 50 to disseminate his unique Senchaho (method of green tea).

sen.j: 以後は御典医時代に築かれた公家人脈に支えられて煎茶道流派「小川流」の構築にいそしむ。
sen.e: After then, he devoted himself to establish 'Ogawa school' of green tea ceremony, being supported by his contacts in the court nobles' society built up over years of his service as a Gotenni.

sen.j: 近衛忠熙、鷹司政通、一条忠香ら摂関家の当主が主なパトロンであり、他久我建通、万里小路正房、坊城俊克、勧修寺顕彰、広幡基豊、千種有功らとも交流があり、特に堀河康親とは親しく交流していた。
sen.e: His main patrons were family heads of Sekkan-ke (the families which produced the Regent and the Chief Adviser to the Emperor) including Tadahiro KONOE, Masamichi TAKATSUKASA and Tadaka ICHIJO, and he also maintained interchanges with Takemichi KOGA, Naofusa MADENOKOJI, Toshikatsu BOJO, Akiteru KAJUJI, Mototoyo HIROHATA, Arikoto CHIGUSA, and, above all, closely with Yasuchika HORIKAWA.
